newsitem.title: USA: U.S. independent bankers plan credit card service.
newsitem.headline: U.S. independent bankers plan credit card service.

text.p: The board of directors of the Independent Bankers Association of America (IBAA) Monday approved a plan to provide credit card services for smaller community banks.
The IBAA said the plan, announced at the group's fall meeting, calls for formation of a limited-purpose credit card bank.
The bank will be established by IBAA Bancard Inc., the trade association's 11-year-old card and payment services subsidiary.

"In an era of heightened credit card competition and increased bank merger activity, this credit card bank will allow community bankers to pool their resources to offer credit card products to consumers," said Leland M. Stenehjem, IBAA president.

"Community banks are increasingly frozen out as direct issuers and left to choose from agent programs of mega-bank issuers," said Dave Ballweg, chairman of IBAA Bancard. "They received limited income potential, and few, if any, safeguards against cross-sell tactics that jeopardize a bank's best customer relationships.
IBAA represents 5,500 independent community banks in the U.S.
